title: What is CF in a scientific name? - Quora

response.answer_text: The abbreviation cf. (short for the Latin: confer/conferatur, both meaning "compare") is used in writing to refer the reader to other material to make a comparison with the topic being discussed. It is used to form a contrast, for example: "Abbott (2010) found supportive results in her memory experiment, unlike those of previous work (cf. Zeller & Williams, 2007)." It is recommended that cf. be used only to suggest a comparison, and the word see be used to point to a source of information. Cf - Wikipedia. More here: Why do some scientific names have cf. in them?
